WorkItem.Description: I was looking around in the mp5 sources in the slot tab and found that the evaluator thingy is putting in intellect as a source of MP5 for holy priests. to my knowlege, i can safely say that intellect is not a source of MP5 for a Holy Priest, and it is instead detremental to a Holy Priest due to priest spells costing a percentage of mana rather than a set amount, (although for the purposes of a disc priest its valid, yadda yadda yadda,) and that it should be evaluating Spirit in its place. Ive tried looking around in the program to change this factor, but i dont seem to be able to. I've tried to find a way to balance it by custom setting the value iof intellect, but it throws off my mana pool, thus lowering my sustained healing numbers by alot. Please help!! Thanks!

Comments.Message: Intellect increases your mana pool.  Your spells cost a percentage of BASE mana, not of your current mana.  Therefore, more intellect = more mana = more spells to cast.  You said it yourself; changing intellect throws off your mana pool and lowers your sustained healing.  As a result, increasing intellect would increase your mana pool, and thus your sustained healing (because your spell costs remain CONSTANT with respect to intellect).  If you don't believe me, get yourself a mage and go in-game, then check the spell costs before and after he casts Arcane Intellect on you.

Yeah, please check again, take off all your gear, see how much a spell cost, then requip all your gear, and check again. You will see that more mana = you can cast more spells, not the same amount.

The reason HolyPriest assumes that Intellect = MP5 is that it converts the additional mana from gaining intellect into mana over time. And MP5 is Mana per 5 sec. So if you gain 150 extra mana over 6 minutes, that is the same as 150 / (6*60) * 5 = 2.0383 MP5. If duration of fight increases or is lowered, the MP5 effect of Intellect will change.
